page.title: 06EMPLOYMENT BEULAH - GARTH
page.content: Large part of the population are retired, especially in villages,where some are English incomers.The main employment is agriculture.School leavers either go into the family farm or qualify in colleges and work in cities.Young females work in shops, banks, offices, or on family farms. Married women, including farmers' wives often work part-time in school, hotels, and domestic work,or full-time in offices or shops.Apart from agriculture few adult males have other jobs except for a small number of self-employed. These include a garage propietor, undertaker, agricultural salesman, shopkeeper, forestry consultant, publican, and a wooden toymaker.
